intro: Houstonia ouachitana, commonly known as the Ouachita bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has small, lance-shaped leaves. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
